medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was screened at day 2 of life, showing an abnormally high TSH level (494 mIU/L). By day 11, she was diagnosed as euthyroid. Normal growth was observed in early life, but by age 7 years and 3 months, there was a significant height decrease (117 cm, -3.0 SD) and weight of 22 kg. Severe hypothyroidism was diagnosed later, with a TSH level of 446 mIU/L.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No previous history of hypothyroidism reported.
medical_history.family_history: No clinical history of hypothyroidism in the patient's parents. Both parents and maternal half-sister were euthyroid. The younger sister showed elevated TSH but was also euthyroid.
